activity.text:
üîßAnthropic Functions

A wrapper around @AnthropicAI models to expose support for function calling in the same way as @OpenAI

Uses XML encoding under the hood, as per docs thats what Claude is best at.

Added some examples for tagging and extraction

https://t.co/hTfabV929X https://t.co/mWyKSRWX4H

Yes! you can do this with any agent by setting `handle_parsing_errors=True` when initializing the AgentExecutor

‚≠êÔ∏èMulti-Action Agent w/ @OpenAI Functions‚≠êÔ∏è

OpenAI functions allows the LLM to select a single tool to use... but often times it can be more efficient to have the LLM select MULTIPLE tools to use (if tasks can be done in parallel)

Enter... the `openai-multi-functions` agentüëá https://t.co/TuSXu1Wg8Q

An update to the BabyAGI notebook from yesterday. Shows how to swap out the execution LLM to be an agent itself with tools

Allows BabyAGI to interact with the external world. IMO, this framework + specialized prompt engineering & tool equipment can go a long way

quoted.text:
‚≠êÔ∏èBabyAGI + Tools‚≠êÔ∏è

By default, BabyAGI by @yoheinakajima just "executes" things with an LLM response (eg, makes things up)

By changing the execution chain to be an agent with tools, the execution step can now lookup real info, take actions, etc

Docs: https://t.co/0VrnEgjpiD https://t.co/turVMNxogu
